MY STORY

Born and raised in the suburbs of Seattle, WA.

Attended Marquette University (Milwaukee, WI). Graduated with a BS in Bioelectrical Engineering and a minor in Electrical Engineering. Participated in MU Women's Club Lacrosse as well as Alpha Chi Omega Women's Fraternity.

Interned with the Food & Drug Administration (White Oak, MD) in the Human Device Interaction Lab. Work consisted of research and analysis of testing methods related to upper extremity prosthetic devices.

Attended and completed the Le Wagon coding bootcamp in Bali, Indonesia. Since completing the camp, I have been working on improving and expanding my coding skills through collaborative and personal projects.
